A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
It's a mixed bag. Has some good stuff and some really bad stuff.

The first scene with Luke ignores the continuity from the previous movie. Rey is far from Luke and shows his saber. Then in this movie\, she actually walks and gets close to him.  This is just the beginning of the problems.

Second Act is where things get bad. The movie completely loses himself with its several subplots and even subplots inside subplots. 

It gets better in the third act\, but then the movie is really damaged by this point.

The directing is fine\, the acting is hit or miss\, Daisy Ridley got fat ( it's easy to notice ).

Writing is where things get bad with this movie. Obviously this isn't a bad movie. It's actually watchable BUT it has way too many flaws to be ignored.

I'm still curious about the next one\, but not excited.
